intro: Tetracera rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including India, Indonesia, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its rounded, glossy leaves and small, clustered yellowish flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Tetracera rotundifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
